transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Hey Colin, Mark Wachak calling. Did I catch you at a bad time there?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Yeah, I'm a little caught up with some things right now.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay, well, fair enough. Would it be okay if I took 30 seconds, told you why I called,

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: and if after it doesn't make sense, we could just hang up? Does that sound fair?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Yeah, that's alright.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay, great. So, I'm a sales strategist who works with mid-sized companies to create a game plan for dramatically increasing sales.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: and my clients typically come to me when they're losing sales to low-cost competitors.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Their teams are inconsistently hitting sales targets

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: or finally they're just frustrated with the lack of results from their existing sales team.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Any of those issues ring true to you?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Yeah, actually not hitting sales goals has kind of been a problem for my company recently.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Tell me just a little bit more about that.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Well, you know, we have about 20 to 25 agents in my office,

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: and it just seems like we've been losing a lot of these big condo sales to our competitors recently.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: We're not moving quick enough.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: When we are showing the places, we seem to be just somehow not closing the sales.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: I haven't been able to figure out what the real issues are, but we're definitely losing some business.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: I mean, what have you done to fix this?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: You know, I've had some chats with my bigger sales guys to see what the problems are that they seem to think.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: You know, why aren't they closing these sales compared to what they were doing six months ago and a year ago.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Again, we haven't really been able to put our finger on something.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: The market is great right now.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: There's places that are selling in a day to two days after they go on the market.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: And we just not getting those places We having people come to us People want to buy condos They want to move quickly and we just losing out on a lot of great places It a really common issue I hear

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: What would you say this issue is costing you and your organization?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: I'd have to say, I'd probably say around two and a half to three million.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay. Well, Colin, can I make a recommendation? Yeah, sure.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Why don't we set up an appointment and get together face-to-face?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: I'd say it takes about 60 minutes or so, and we can talk this further.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: I think there are some ideas that I could share with you to really help you solve this challenge.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: I mean, does that make any sense to you?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Yeah, I'd be willing to set up a meeting.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay, great.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: So what works for you next week?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Next week, I think I'm pretty busy Monday and Tuesday, but I could do like a Wednesday afternoon or Thursday morning.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Looking at my calendar, Wednesday afternoon is fine with me.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: So what's best for you Wednesday afternoon?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Hold on.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: I'm just pulling up my calendar.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: Anytime after 2 p.m.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: I can actually make 2.30 work.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: That's perfect.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay, and so the address for your office, just to confirm, is 8 Broadway Street in Boston, right?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: That's correct.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: Okay, great.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: And just before I hang up, is there anyone else that you would want to include in this conversation

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: who might be involved in this kind of a decision?

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: No, really just I'm the decision maker.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Colin: So I think there's nobody that I can think of that I'd want to bring along.

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: okay terrific well then I will see you at your office and we will discuss this

transcript.speaker: Speaker 1
transcript.text: Mason: a little bit further then great thanks for the call thank you
